derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin inventorium, alteration of late Latin inventarium, literally a list of what is found, from Latin invenire 'come upon'

entry.def: An inventory is a written list of all the objects in a particular place.

example.ex: Before starting, he made an inventory of everything that was to stay.
example.tran: 开始之前,他把所有要留下的东西列了详细的清单。

entry.def: An inventory is a supply or stock of something.

example.ex: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
example.tran: 每艘快艇 12 张帆的储备

means.word_mean: 1. a detailed list of all the items in stock
2. the merchandise that a shop has on hand;

sentences.sentence: "they carried a vast inventory of hardware"

means.word_mean: 3. (accounting) the value of a firm's current assets including raw materials and work in progress and finished goods

sentences.sentence: "he dipped into his intellectual armory to find an answer"

means.word_mean: 5. making an itemized list of merchandise or supplies on hand;
1. make or include in an itemized record or report;

sentences.sentence: "Inventory all books before the end of the year"
